Respect "*_selected_bg" setting even in the presence of "-MessageList-new-mail-bg-color"
Add support for CSS property "-MessageList-new-mail-fg-color"
Add support for CSS property "-MessageList-new-mail-fg-color"

note.body:
Thanks for the feedback, I'll have a look.

As to the reason for this, I prefer to set a separate foreground colour for new mail, rather than a separate background. Since `-MessageList-new-mail-bg-color` was already supported, I figured a `-MessageList-new-mail-fg-color` would be nice to have as well. Especially in a dark theme, it's really hard to distinguish unread and read mail, since the only distinction is that unread mail is listed in a bold font. This is easier to spot in dark-on-light than in light-on-dark.

And as far as the automatic foreground colour determination is concerned, that has a small bug as well, but I'll do that in a separate issue when I have the time.

events.target_title: Add support for CSS property "-MessageList-new-mail-fg-color"

note.body: BTW, would it be easier if I submit a merge request?

events.target_title: Respect "*_selected_bg" setting even in the presence of "-MessageList-new-mail-bg-color"

note.body:
But this defeats the purpose of `-MessageList-new-mail-bg-color`. In evolution 3.30 this was working correctly. My use case is that I don't mark mails as read automatically, which allows me to scroll through the list of messages using the cursor keys. Since I use a dark theme, I need to use `-MessageList-new-mail-bg-color` to easily distinguish unread mail from read mail. With the current logic, it is impossible to see which message is the currently selected one if it happens to be one of the unread messages.

Compare the two screenshots attached. The first ("a") is unpatched evolution. The second is with the patch applied.

![Screenshot-a-20190501212427-1090x789](/uploads/f7ec23e2b449d6f97bd0c7b1e9ffd834/Screenshot-a-20190501212427-1090x789.png)

![Screenshot-b-20190501212638-1090x789](/uploads/da5a2acfb5b71e7639fcfe4e86580151/Screenshot-b-20190501212638-1090x789.png)

Again, in 3.30 the behaviour for selected messages was as in the second screenshot, which was fine. I understand the reasoning for using the label colour as the background colour if a labelled message is selected (even if I think it's very ugly), but it currently does not work for unread messages that are coloured with `-MessageList-new-mail-bg-color`, which is exactly my use case (also because there is *no* `-MessageList-new-mail-fg-color` that I could use for marking unread mail).

So `-MessageList-new-mail-bg-color` is broken as it is currently, and evolution is pretty much unusable in a dark theme, because there is no other way to make unread messages stand out more.

Suggestions are welcome...

events.target_title: Respect "*_selected_bg" setting even in the presence of "-MessageList-new-mail-bg-color"

note.body: I just added a remark to the bugzilla issue. Basically, this change has broken the `-MessageList-new-mail-bg-color` feature.

events.target_title: Add support for CSS property "-MessageList-new-mail-fg-color"

note.body:
Ok, I think I have something working now. Fixed the indentation and attribute caching. It will still do a `gdk_rgba_to_string()` and corresponding `g_free()`, so I'm not sure if that is super efficient, but it's similar to what the other code in that `case` block does. Note also, that the indenting in the original source is also inconsistent. Argument lists in function declarations are often indented with spaces to align under `some_type function_name( `, but not always.

Note: I kept the spelling of `colour` in variables names in the `case` block, but spelled it `color` in the `priv` attribute and subseqent code. This is to stay consistent within the local `case` block. This block could probably use a `s/colour/color/g` touch.

Author: Steven Bakker <sb@monkey-mind.net>

See newly attached patch.

[add_new-mail-fg-color.patch](/uploads/89ff4a85136b1196a49a704e9d49d911/add_new-mail-fg-color.patch)

events.target_title: Add support for CSS property "-MessageList-new-mail-fg-color"

gnome-terminal and terminator's display bug

note.body:
**clear steps to reproduce (step by step);**
1) build deep document use **Chinese character** (alphabet character do not have this bug)
2) cd into the deepest document (the path longer than the terminal width)

**expected result:**
the document name before '$' is right, and no extral character show behind '$'

**actual result.:**
the document name before '$' is not right and some extral character show behind '$'

events.target_title: ATA secure erase UNLOCK

note.body:
Found it! I didn't pay attention before to the fact the Gnome Disk Utility is a graphical front-end for `udisks`. Searching the udisks source code I found the password at [storaged-project/udisks:src/udiskslinuxdriveata.c#L1895](https://github.com/storaged-project/udisks/blob/e7791e595aed6e059fc116bd137898a2b6ba3d40/src/udiskslinuxdriveata.c#L1895). After some months with the HDD locked, everything good now.

Password used in ATA Enhanced Security Erase: **xxxx**

+1

gnome-software leaks memory while trying to get updates
gnome-software leaks memory while trying to get updates

note.body:
I ran into this bug today again and was able to reproduce it. Unfortunately I am not able to reproduce this with valgrind.

Basically this seems to happen when gnome software tries to download "large" RPMs (>20MB). In this case it was the package ```glibc-all-langpacks-2.27-32.fc28.x86_64.rpm``` which is 25MB. Last time it was the kernel package. The smaller packages could be downloaded without issues.

Just like last time gnome-software keeps canceling and restarting the download of that package. After every cancel-restart cycle (which takes about 10 seconds) memory usage increases a couple of MB, after 5 minutes it increased about 150MB. 

I took a quick look at the source code of gnome-software and saw that changes of the network status leads to cancellation of package downloads but this is definitely not the case for me. I don't know what else could be a cause for cancellations. Maybe there is a plugin crashing and reloading?

This is how I was able to reproduce the problem:

1. Kill gnome software if it's running
```
killall gnome-software
```
2. Clear the package cache
```
sudo rm -rf /var/cache/PackageKit/28/metadata/updates/packages/
```
3. Make gnome-software look for updates on the next run
```
gsettings set org.gnome.software check-timestamp 0
```
4. Open a new terminal window and run ```pkmon```
5. restart gnome-software
```
gnome-software --gapplication-service
```


Here are some logs

Output of pkmon:

[pkmon.log](/uploads/b4023c0065eca8f6f9c6a0a631b95046/pkmon.log)

Console output of gnome-software:

[gs-console.log](/uploads/8e10b28483721d93f5af2f3f3227a54a/gs-console.log)

Verbose console output of gnome-software:

[gs-verbose.log.gz](/uploads/75b8764ac2e60374550db6f45c1d841d/gs-verbose.log.gz)

events.target_title: System immediately goes in suspend mode after login

note.body:
The same happens to me on Fedora 30 with Gnome 3.32, it did not happen on Fedora 29.
The bug only occurs when logging in to the Gnome-Xorg session after a system boot, not on wayland. I have disabled *Suspend when lid is closed* in Gnome tweaks but it has no effect.

events.target_title: lock screen hangs when there is a broken mount
icon network not showing in gnome-shell

note.body:
same problem on Fedora 28 after an update. I've access on internet with my wired connection, but in top bar, I've no icon, same for my VPN, tunnel is, but no icon too.
I fix the issue by disable the service libvrtd who create on every boot a bridge named "vrtbr0".

events.target_title: Allow to select multiple layers

note.body: Today I screen-recorded my desktop in GIF format to send a bug report for another Gnome project. However, this screen capture disclose lot of my private life, so un tried to apply a Gaussian blur to some part of GIF frames. Unfortunately I notice that Gimp can't provide "select multiple layer", it's to much work to select a GIF frame one by one, then make selection, and then apply blur.

events.target_title: zfs partition wrongly shows occupying the whole disk

note.body:
```
# blkid --version
blkid from util-linux 2.32  (libblkid 2.32.0, 21-Mar-2018)
```

If it has anything to do with this, I couldn't create the zfs pool on sda4 on linux because that would bring features which are currently unsupported on openzfsonosx.
So I created it on linux but formatted ext4 and then booted MacOS and created the openzfsonosx zpool on sda4.
